AvaTax API

REST interface to Avalara's enterprise tax service, AvaTax.

Have development credentials? Generate a Postman Collection with your account info!


Retrieve a single transaction

Try Retrieve a single transaction now!


Api Endpoint
GET /Users/josh.sherman/src/developer-dot/dynamic/swagger/avatax/v2/rest.json/api/v2/companies/{companyCode}/transactions/{transactionCode}

Headers
Authorization: Basic aHR0cHdhdGNoOmY=

Querystring Parameters

$include

A comma separated list of child objects to return underneath the primary object.

string

Path Parameters

companyCode
Required

The company code of the company that recorded this transaction

string
transactionCode
Required

The transaction code to retrieve

string

Response

id

The unique ID number of this transaction.

integer
code

A unique customer-provided code identifying this transaction.

string
companyId

The unique ID number of the company that recorded this transaction.

integer
date

The date on which this transaction occurred.

string
taxDate

The date that was used when calculating tax for this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the transaction date; however, when a consumer returns a product purchased in a previous month, it may be necessary to specify the date of the original transaction in order to correctly return the exact amount of sales tax that was charged of the consumer on the original date they purchased the product.

string
paymentDate

The date when payment was made on this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the date of the transaction.

string
status

The status of the transaction.

string
type

The type of the transaction. For Returns customers, a transaction type of "Invoice" will be reported to the tax authorities. A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer. A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company. A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company. An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

string
batchCode

If this transaction was created as part of a batch, this code indicates which batch.

string
currencyCode

The three-character ISO 4217 currency code that was used for payment for this transaction.

string
customerUsageType

The customer usage type for this transaction. Customer usage types often affect exemption or taxability rules.

string
customerVendorCode

CustomerVendorCode

string
exemptNo

If this transaction was exempt, this field will contain the word "Exempt".

string
reconciled

If this transaction has been reconciled against the company's ledger, this value is set to true.

boolean
locationCode

If this transaction was made from a specific reporting location, this is the code string of the location. For customers using Returns, this indicates how tax will be reported according to different locations on the tax forms.

string
purchaseOrderNo

The customer-supplied purchase order number of this transaction.

string
referenceCode

A user-defined reference code for this transaction.

string
salespersonCode

The salesperson who provided this transaction. Not required.

string
taxOverrideType

If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates what type of tax override was applied.

string
taxOverrideAmount

If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax that was requested by the customer.

number
taxOverrideReason

If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the reason for the tax override.

string
totalAmount

The total amount of this transaction.

number
totalExempt

The amount of this transaction that was exempt.

number
totalTax

The total tax calculated for all lines in this transaction.

number
totalTaxable

The portion of the total amount of this transaction that was taxable.

number
totalTaxCalculated

If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax Avalara calculated for the transaction.

number
adjustmentReason

If this transaction was adjusted, indicates the unique ID number of the reason why the transaction was adjusted.

string
adjustmentDescription

If this transaction was adjusted, indicates a description of the reason why the transaction was adjusted.

string
locked

If this transaction has been reported to a tax authority, this transaction is considered locked and may not be adjusted after reporting.

boolean
region

The two-or-three character ISO region code of the region for this transaction.

string
country

The two-character ISO 3166 code of the country for this transaction.

string
version

If this transaction was adjusted, this indicates the version number of this transaction. Incremented each time the transaction is adjusted.

integer
softwareVersion

The software version used to calculate this transaction.

string
originAddressId

The unique ID number of the origin address for this transaction.

integer
destinationAddressId

The unique ID number of the destination address for this transaction.

integer
exchangeRateEffectiveDate

If this transaction included foreign currency exchange, this is the date as of which the exchange rate was calculated.

string
exchangeRate

If this transaction included foreign currency exchange, this is the exchange rate that was used.

number
isSellerImporterOfRecord

If true, this seller was considered the importer of record of a product shipped internationally.

boolean
description

Description of this transaction.

string
email

Email address associated with this transaction.

string
modifiedDate

The date/time when this record was last modified.

string
modifiedUserId

The user ID of the user who last modified this record.

integer
Array[Lines]
id

The unique ID number of this transaction line item.

integer
transactionId

The unique ID number of the transaction to which this line item belongs.

integer
lineNumber

The line number or code indicating the line on this invoice or receipt or document.

string
boundaryOverrideId

The unique ID number of the boundary override applied to this line item.

integer
customerUsageType

The customer usage type for this line item. Usage type often affects taxability rules.

string
description

A description of the item or service represented by this line.

string
destinationAddressId

The unique ID number of the destination address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the destination address and origin address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

integer
originAddressId

The unique ID number of the origin address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the origin address and destination address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

integer
discountAmount

The amount of discount that was applied to this line item. This represents the difference between list price and sale price of the item. In general, a discount represents money that did not change hands; tax is calculated on only the amount of money that changed hands.

number
discountTypeId

The type of discount, if any, that was applied to this line item.

integer
exemptAmount

The amount of this line item that was exempt.

number
exemptCertId

The unique ID number of the exemption certificate that applied to this line item.

integer
exemptNo

If this line item was exempt, this string contains the word 'Exempt'.

string
isItemTaxable

True if this item is taxable.

boolean
isSSTP

True if this item is a Streamlined Sales Tax line item.

boolean
itemCode

The code string of the item represented by this line item.

string
lineAmount

The total amount of the transaction, including both taxable and exempt. This is the total price for all items. To determine the individual item price, divide this by quantity.

number
quantity

The quantity of products sold on this line item.

number
ref1

A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

string
ref2

A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

string
reportingDate

The date when this transaction should be reported. By default, all transactions are reported on the date when the actual transaction took place. In some cases, line items may be reported later due to delayed shipments or other business reasons.

string
revAccount

The revenue account number for this line item.

string
sourcing

Indicates whether this line item was taxed according to the origin or destination.

string
tax

The amount of tax generated for this line item.

number
taxableAmount

The taxable amount of this line item.

number
taxCalculated

The tax calculated for this line by Avalara. If the transaction was calculated with a tax override, this amount will be different from the "tax" value.

number
taxCode

The code string for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

string
taxCodeId

The unique ID number for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

integer
taxDate

The date that was used for calculating tax amounts for this line item. By default, this date should be the same as the document date. In some cases, for example when a consumer returns a product purchased previously, line items may be calculated using a tax date in the past so that the consumer can receive a refund for the correct tax amount that was charged when the item was originally purchased.

string
taxEngine

The tax engine identifier that was used to calculate this line item.

string
taxOverrideType

If a tax override was specified, this indicates the type of tax override.

string
taxOverrideAmount

If a tax override was specified, this indicates the amount of tax that was requested.

number
taxOverrideReason

If a tax override was specified, represents the reason for the tax override.

string
taxIncluded

True if tax was included in the purchase price of the item.

boolean
Array[Details]
id

The unique ID number of this tax detail.

integer
transactionLineId

The unique ID number of the line within this transaction.

integer
transactionId

The unique ID number of this transaction.

integer
addressId

The unique ID number of the address used for this tax detail.

integer
country

The two character ISO 3166 country code of the country where this tax detail is assigned.

string
region

The two-or-three character ISO region code for the region where this tax detail is assigned.

string
countyFIPS

For U.S. transactions, the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code for the county where this tax detail is assigned.

string
stateFIPS

For U.S. transactions, the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code for the state where this tax detail is assigned.

string
exemptAmount

The amount of this line that was considered exempt in this tax detail.

number
exemptReasonId

The unique ID number of the exemption reason for this tax detail.

integer
inState

True if this detail element represented an in-state transaction.

boolean
jurisCode

The code of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

string
jurisName

The name of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

string
jurisdictionId

The unique ID number of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

integer
signatureCode

The Avalara-specified signature code of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

string
stateAssignedNo

The state assigned number of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

string
jurisType

The type of the jurisdiction to which this tax detail applies.

string
nonTaxableAmount

The amount of this line item that was considered nontaxable in this tax detail.

number
nonTaxableRuleId

The rule according to which portion of this detail was considered nontaxable.

integer
nonTaxableType

The type of nontaxability that was applied to this tax detail.

string
rate

The rate at which this tax detail was calculated.

number
rateRuleId

The unique ID number of the rule according to which this tax detail was calculated.

integer
rateSourceId

The unique ID number of the source of the rate according to which this tax detail was calculated.

integer
serCode

For Streamlined Sales Tax customers, the SST Electronic Return code under which this tax detail should be applied.

string
sourcing

Indicates whether this tax detail applies to the origin or destination of the transaction.

string
tax

The amount of tax for this tax detail.

number
taxableAmount

The taxable amount of this tax detail.

number
taxType

The type of tax that was calculated. Depends on the company's nexus settings as well as the jurisdiction's tax laws.

string
taxName

The name of the tax against which this tax amount was calculated.

string
taxAuthorityTypeId

The type of the tax authority to which this tax will be remitted.

integer
taxRegionId

The unique ID number of the tax region.

integer
taxCalculated

The amount of tax that was calculated. This amount may be different if a tax override was used. If the customer specified a tax override, this calculated tax value represents the amount of tax that would have been charged if Avalara had calculated the tax for the rule.

number
taxOverride

The amount of tax override that was specified for this tax line.

number
rateType

The rate type for this tax detail.

string
Array[Addresses]
id

The unique ID number of this address.

integer
transactionId

The unique ID number of the document to which this address belongs.

integer
boundaryLevel

The boundary level at which this address was validated.

string
line1

The first line of the address.

string
line2

The second line of the address.

string
line3

The third line of the address.

string
city

The city for the address.

string
region

The region, state, or province for the address.

string
postalCode

The postal code or zip code for the address.

string
country

The country for the address.

string
taxRegionId

The unique ID number of the tax region for this address.

integer
Array[Summary]
country

Two character ISO-3166 country code.

string
region

Two or three character ISO region, state or province code, if applicable.

string
jurisType

The type of jurisdiction that collects this tax.

string
jurisCode

Jurisdiction Code for the taxing jurisdiction

string
jurisName

The name of the jurisdiction that collects this tax.

string
taxAuthorityType

The unique ID of the Tax Authority Type that collects this tax.

integer
stateAssignedNo

The state assigned number of the jurisdiction that collects this tax.

string
taxType

The tax type of this tax.

string
taxName

The name of the tax.

string
taxGroup

Group code when special grouping is enabled.

string
rateType

Indicates the tax rate type.

string
taxable

Tax Base - The adjusted taxable amount.

number
rate

Tax Rate - The rate of taxation, as a fraction of the amount.

number
tax

Tax amount - The calculated tax (Base * Rate).

number
taxCalculated

Tax Calculated by Avalara AvaTax. This may be overriden by a TaxOverride.TaxAmount.

number
nonTaxable

The amount of the transaction that was non-taxable.

number
exemption

The amount of the transaction that was exempt.

number

An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

Perform multiple actions on a transaction

id

integer
code

date

The date on which this transaction occurred.

string
taxDate

The date that was used when calculating tax for this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the transaction date; however, when a consumer returns a product purchased in a previous month, it may be necessary to specify the date of the original transaction in order to correctly return the exact amount of sales tax that was charged of the consumer on the original date they purchased the product.

string
paymentDate

The date when payment was made on this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the date of the transaction.

string
status

The status of the transaction.

string
type

The type of the transaction. For Returns customers, a transaction type of "Invoice" will be reported to the tax authorities. A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer. A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company. A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company. An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

string
batchCode

If this transaction was created as part of a batch, this code indicates which batch.

The unique ID number of the destination address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the destination address and origin address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

The unique ID number of the origin address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the origin address and destination address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

Response

id

integer
code

string
companyId

The unique ID number of the company that recorded this transaction.

integer

The date on which this transaction occurred.

string
taxDate

The date that was used when calculating tax for this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the transaction date; however, when a consumer returns a product purchased in a previous month, it may be necessary to specify the date of the original transaction in order to correctly return the exact amount of sales tax that was charged of the consumer on the original date they purchased the product.

string
paymentDate

The date when payment was made on this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the date of the transaction.

string
status

The status of the transaction.

string
type

The type of the transaction. For Returns customers, a transaction type of "Invoice" will be reported to the tax authorities. A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer. A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company. A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company. An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

string
batchCode

If this transaction was created as part of a batch, this code indicates which batch.

string
currencyCode

The three-character ISO 4217 currency code that was used for payment for this transaction.

The date that was used when calculating tax for this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the transaction date; however, when a consumer returns a product purchased in a previous month, it may be necessary to specify the date of the original transaction in order to correctly return the exact amount of sales tax that was charged of the consumer on the original date they purchased the product.

string
type

The type of the transaction. For Returns customers, a transaction type of "Invoice" will be reported to the tax authorities. A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer. A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company. A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company. An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.
